name: accessibly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that can be easily obtained or reached: She insisted that tickets for her shows be accessibly priced.
in a way that can be reached or used by all people, including those who cannot walk well, or who cannot see, hear, etc.: The toilets are all located accessibly on the ground floor.
in a way that is easy to understand: She writes really accessibly about difficult issues.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company specializes in accessibly luxurious fashion. Water coolers are arranged accessibly throughout the campus.The exhibition is well curated and accessibly presented, with many clear and useful information boards.She stated her argument clearly and accessibly in the article.
